patient_summary: The patient is a 74-year-old man who had a tumor removed from his bladder. He needs to see a urologist in 6 weeks to check on the tumor. The doctor used a spinal anesthetic for the surgery. The patient had microscopic and gross hematuria. The patient had an IVP which showed an enlarged prostate and normal upper tracts. Cystoscopy showed a 2.5- to 3-cm left lateral wall bladder tumor. The tumor was removed using a resectoscope. The bladder was irrigated with sterile fluid. The patient is in stable condition.
